Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals and label them.
The student can draw and label the places where the different plants and animals live (such as water, forest, field).
The student can identify and label things that plants and animals need to survive, like water, air, and food.
The student can show and label how plants and animals get what they need from their environment (e.g., fish live in water, deer eat leaves).
The student can show the connections between plant and animal needs and their environments in their drawing.
The student can illustrate how plants and animals and their habitats work together as a system to meet their needs.
